purpose.summary: Establish clear, consistent rules for crediting sales performance to ensure fair attribution of sales to appropriate sales representatives, transparency and predictability, dispute minimization, data integrity, and support for business objectives (collaboration, customer focus).
objectives: Fair attribution of sales to appropriate sales representatives
Transparency and predictability in crediting decisions
Support for business objectives (collaboration, customer focus)

appliesTo: All sales performance tracked for incentive compensation purposes
Other performance measures per plan documents

provisions.title: Core Crediting Principles
provisions.content: Fundamental rules governing how sales credit is assigned.

subProvisions.title: Territory-Based Crediting (Primary Rule)
subProvisions.content: Credit goes to the sales representative assigned to the customer's territory at the time of sale. Rationale: Clear ownership and accountability, encourages territory management, minimizes disputes. Territory determined by customer location (billing address, shipping address, or designated office), territory assignments documented in CRM (Salesforce), territory maps maintained by Sales Operations.

subProvisions.title: Closed Date Determines Credit
subProvisions.content: Performance is credited based on when the transaction is officially closed/booked. For Revenue: Close Date = Date order is booked in ERP system or contract is signed (whichever represents commitment). For Orders: Close Date = Date purchase order received or contract signed.

subProvisions.title: One Transaction, One Credit (No Double-Dipping)
subProvisions.content: Each transaction is credited only once (100% to one rep or split among multiple reps totaling 100%). Exception: Overlay/Specialist roles may receive separate credit (see Section 7).

subProvisions.title: Standard Sale (Single Rep)
subProvisions.content: Rep in assigned territory closes deal: 100% credit to assigned territory rep.

subProvisions.title: New Customer vs. Existing Customer
subProvisions.content: Crediting Rule: Same - credit to assigned territory rep. Exception - New Customer Bonus: If plan includes new customer acquisition bonus, rep receives bonus for first sale to new customer. Subsequent sales to same customer credited normally (no repeat bonus).

subProvisions.title: Repeat/Renewal Business
subProvisions.content: Current territory owner receives credit, even if prior rep established relationship. Rationale: Encourages ongoing customer relationship management.

subProvisions.title: Customer Relocates
subProvisions.content: Credit to territory where customer is located at time of sale. If customer relocates mid-sales cycle and deal was substantially developed by original rep, may split credit (see Split Credit Scenarios).

provisions.title: Split Credit Scenarios
provisions.content: Rules for dividing sales credit among multiple representatives.

subProvisions.title: Team Selling (Planned Collaboration)
subProvisions.content: Two or more reps collaborate on sale. Standard Split: 50/50 if two reps collaborate equally; other splits (60/40, 70/30, etc.) if contribution differs.
items: Both reps documented in CRM opportunity (before close)
Split percentage agreed in advance (documented in CRM)
Manager approval (if not pre-approved split rule)

subProvisions.title: Territory Transition (Mid-Sales Cycle)
subProvisions.content: Territory reassigned while deal is in progress. Documentation Required: Deal stage documented in CRM at time of transition, manager approval of credit allocation, notification to both reps.

subProvisions.title: House Accounts / National Accounts
subProvisions.content: Account managed at corporate level, but local rep supports. National Account Manager (NAM): Receives primary credit (e.g., 70-80%). Local Territory Rep: Receives support credit (e.g., 20-30%). Split defined in advance for each house account.
items: House account list maintained by Sales Operations
Split percentages documented
Updated annually or when accounts change

subProvisions.title: Channel/Partner Sales
subProvisions.content: Sale facilitated by channel partner, but territory rep supports. Company policy: Full credit to territory rep for channel sales in their territory (Option A - encourages partner enablement).

tables.caption: Territory Transition Crediting Rules by Deal Stage
rows: 50/50 split OR 100% to new rep (manager decides)
100% to old rep if closes within 30 days; otherwise 50/50

provisions.title: Special Situations
provisions.content: Crediting rules for non-standard sales scenarios.

subProvisions.title: Online/E-Commerce Sales
subProvisions.content: Customer purchases via website or e-commerce platform. Credit to territory rep assigned to customer's location. If customer not previously assigned, use billing/shipping address to determine territory. Rationale: Territory rep still responsible for customer relationship, even if purchase is self-service.

subProvisions.title: Inside Sales / BDR Support
subProvisions.content: Inside sales or BDR generates lead; field rep closes deal. Field Rep: Receives full credit for revenue/order. Inside Sales/BDR: May receive separate credit/bonus for qualified lead (if plan includes lead generation bonus). No Split: Field rep and inside sales on different plans; not split.

subProvisions.title: Customer Service / Account Manager Orders
subProvisions.content: Customer places routine order with customer service (not sales rep). Credit to assigned territory rep. Customer service not commissioned on sales. Exception: If customer service on sales incentive plan, may receive credit per their plan terms.

subProvisions.title: Demo/Loaner/Internal Use Equipment
subProvisions.content: Product provided as demo, loaner, or for internal company use. No Credit: Demo units, loaners, and internal use do not count toward sales quota. Exception: If demo converts to sale, then credit per standard rules. Documentation: Demo/loaner transactions tagged in ERP system (exclude from comp calculation).

subProvisions.title: Returns, Cancellations, Chargebacks
subProvisions.content: Customer cancels order or returns product after rep received credit. Chargeback: Rep's performance is reduced (clawback of credit). Applies to rep who received original credit (even if they've left territory or company). Chargeback applied in month/quarter when cancellation occurs. Plan Language Required: Clawback provision must be in plan document and acknowledged by participant.

provisions.title: Overlay and Specialist Roles
provisions.content: Crediting for specialist and overlay positions.

subProvisions.title: Overlay Structure
subProvisions.content: Specialist (e.g., product specialist, solutions architect) supports field rep but also has own quota. Field Rep: Receives credit for full revenue (per standard rules). Specialist: Receives credit for specific products/services (double crediting, but measured on different metrics). Each has different quota and plan; not splitting one pool.

subProvisions.title: Sales Engineer / Pre-Sales Support
subProvisions.content: Sales Engineer typically NOT directly commissioned on revenue. May receive team-based bonus or activity-based incentive (not deal credit).

provisions.title: Crediting Timeframes
provisions.content: Rules governing when credit is applied and cut-off dates.

subProvisions.title: When Credit is Applied
subProvisions.content: Credit applied when order is booked in ERP system (official system of record). Date captured: Close date, booking date, or contract effective date (per company standard). Company Standard: Credit applied on booking date (when order enters ERP).
items: NOT when verbal commitment received (not yet booked)
NOT when quote issued (not yet closed)
NOT when invoice issued (too late - use booking date)

subProvisions.title: Cut-Off Dates
subProvisions.content: Deadline rules for crediting periods:
items: For monthly plans: Cut-off is last day of month at 11:59 PM (per ERP system timestamp)
For quarterly plans: Cut-off is last day of quarter at 11:59 PM
No exceptions: Orders booked after cut-off count in next period

provisions.title: Credit Disputes
provisions.content: Process for disputing and resolving credit allocation disagreements.

subProvisions.title: How to Dispute Credit
subProvisions.content: If rep believes credit is incorrect:
items: Review Data: Check CRM and ICMT to understand how credit was assigned
Contact Sales Operations: Submit dispute per Dispute Resolution Procedures
Provide Evidence: CRM opportunity details, customer location, timeline, etc.
Timeline: Dispute must be raised within 30 days of performance period close

subProvisions.title: Dispute Resolution Process
subProvisions.content: Three-step resolution process:
items: Step 1: Sales Operations Review - Review CRM data, territory assignments, policy rules; determine correct crediting per policy
Step 2: Manager Decision - If policy unclear or judgment call needed, Sales Manager decides; document rationale
Step 3: Appeal - If rep disagrees, may appeal to Sales VP; VP decision is final

provisions.title: Territory and Account Assignments
provisions.content: Rules for maintaining territory and account assignment data.

subProvisions.title: Territory Master Data
subProvisions.content: Sales Operations maintains territory maps (geographic boundaries or account lists), territory assignments (which rep owns which territory), and effective dates of assignments. System of Record: CRM (Salesforce). Updates: Sales Operations updates within 2 business days of change.

subProvisions.title: Account Assignment
subProvisions.content: How customers are assigned to territories:
items: Geographic: Customer location (billing or shipping address)
Named Accounts: Specific accounts assigned to specific reps (for strategic accounts)
Industry/Segment: By customer industry or size
Conflicts: If customer could belong to multiple territories, Sales Operations determines assignment (documented)

provisions.title: Data Integrity
provisions.content: Requirements for maintaining accurate crediting data.

subProvisions.title: Rep Responsibilities
subProvisions.content: Reps must maintain accurate CRM data:
items: Accurately log opportunities in CRM
Tag correct customer account
Update deal stage as sales progresses
Document any split credit agreements in CRM (before close)
Failure to Document: If split not documented in advance, Sales Operations will apply standard policy (may not be favorable to rep)

subProvisions.title: Sales Operations Audit
subProvisions.content: Regular audit procedures:
items: Quarterly: Audit sample of transactions for crediting accuracy, verify CRM data matches ERP data, identify and correct errors
Annual: Comprehensive review of territory assignments, update territory maps, clean up account assignments

provisions.title: Roles and Responsibilities
provisions.content: Clearly defined roles for all parties involved in sales crediting.

tables.caption: Roles and Responsibilities for Sales Crediting
rows: Maintain territory assignments; apply crediting policy; resolve disputes
Approve split credit arrangements; resolve crediting disputes (first level)
Document opportunities in CRM; adhere to policy; raise disputes promptly
Ensure CRM fields support crediting (territory, account assignment, split %)
Ensure policy aligns with plan design; approve policy updates
